bio: Mr. Weisberger joined Williams, Caliri, Miller & Otley, P.C. in 1989 as an Associate and became a Shareholder of the firm in 1993. His practice emphasizes estate planning, probate, estate and trust administration, and estate, gift and income tax planning. Mr. Weisberger is a frequent lecturer on various estate and trust, business and tax planning matters.

Prior to joining the firm, Mr. Weisberger was with Coopers & Lybrand as an associate (1980-1984), where his practice included gift, estate, and corporate and tax planning. From 1985-1987 he was with the estate and tax planning law firm of Jerome A. Deener, P.C., Hackensack, New Jersey, as a tax Associate, and from 1987-1989 he was a tax attorney with Sills, Cummis, Zuckerman, Radin, Tischman, Epstein & Gross, Newark, New Jersey.

bio: BURRELL IVES HUMPHREYS was a Judge of the New Jersey Superior Court, Appellate Division. He was also Assignment Judge of Hudson County and Essex County, where he was responsible for the operation of all courts in those counties, and Presiding Judge of Chancery in Passaic County.

He was specially designated by the Chief Justice of the New Jersey Supreme Court as the Affordable Housing Judge (Mt. Laurel) for Passaic County; Environmental Judge for Passaic County; and Wiretap Judge for Hudson and other Counties.

He was the Chair of a subcommittee of the Supreme Court Alternate Dispute Resolution Committee and Chair and member of numerous other Supreme Court Committees. He is presently a Member of the Supreme Court Judicial Evaluation Commission.

Judge Humphreys served as a member of the Editorial Board of the New Jersey Law Journal. He served as Co-Chair with Assignment Judge Patricia Costello of the Committee to improve the functioning of the Newark Municipal Court. He is a lecturer and author on legal and judicial subjects, a Fellow of the American Bar Association, a member of Federal, New Jersey and County Bar Associations and a member of the Alternate Dispute Resolution Inn of Court.

Judge Humphreys was formerly a Deputy Attorney General for the State of New Jersey, the former Prosecutor of Passaic County, a Special Prosecutor appointed by the New Jersey Supreme Court to investigate and prosecute Obstruction of Justice and Contempt of Court cases, and a former Special Counsel for the State of New Jersey to institute escheat actions against major corporations.
Judge Humphreys has served as Receiver and Trustee and operated large companies by appointment of federal and state judges in bankruptcy and interlocutory proceedings.

Judge Humphreys was a participant in the World Peace through World Law program sponsored by the American Bar Association; and was a delegate to the 1990 International Conference of Jurists and Lawyers in the former Union of Soviet Socialist Republics sponsored by former United States Secretaries of State.
Judge Humphreys is the author of an article in the New Jersey Law Journal on mediation in sexual harassment employment cases. Martindale Hubbell AV rated (since 1960).

bio: LINDA H. SAMSON, gained wide respect for breaking new ground as the first woman to attain the office of President of The Passaic County Bar Association. She currently serves as a Trustee of the Passaic County Bar Association. Ms. Samson has also been selected to teach family law practice to less-experienced attorneys by the New Jersey Institute for Continuing Legal Education. She is co-chair of the Family Law Section,  a member of the Matrimonial and Complimentary Dispute Resolution Committees and serves on the Women and Minority Concerns Committee of the Passaic County Bar Association. Ms. Samson is also a member of New Jersey State, Morris County, and American Bar Associations and their sections of family law. She volunteers as chair of a Matrimonial Early Settlement Panel in Passaic County.  She is qualified to serve as an Economic Mediator pursuant to New Jersey Court Rule 1:40-12(a)(6). She served as a charter Barrister of the Justice Robert Clifford Inn of the Court, and was a member of the Court's Arbitrator Selection Committee in the Passaic County vicinage. Ms. Samson is past chair of the District XI (Passaic County) Fee Arbitration Committee and served on the District XI (Passaic County) Ethics Committee, both as appointed by the New Jersey Supreme Court.  She was recently appointed to the board of directors of Willing Hands, Inc. a program for developmentally disabled adults. She joined the firm in January of 2005.
